Scroll LLP

Content training, from developing the vision to crafting the copy

Scroll provides training on all aspects of digital and print content for the public sector. Topics can range from detailed instruction on the specifics of high-quality writing and editing to sessions allowing senior stakeholders to explore the organisational benefits and resource implications of developing a new content vision or approach.

Features

  • Training on all aspects of content at all organisational levels
  • Training in current government digital best practice for content
  • Specialist editorial and stakeholder-management training for content designers
  • Training in user needs and designing end-to-end user journeys
  • How to organise and run successful digital content teams
  • Training digital teams in Agile content production
  • Usability and user experience training
  • Training subject-matter experts required to produce or approve digital content
  • Specialist workshops for project sponsors, board members and budget holders
  • Bespoke courses or standard training packages available

Benefits

  • Benefit from Scroll’s decade of experience running successful digital content
  • Clearer, simpler, well-written and organised content means increased user satisfaction
  • Users engage more positively with organisations that communicate well
  • Fewer negative results (incomplete transactions, calls to helplines, complaints, etc.)
  • Senior level buy-in helps projects run smoothly at all levels
  • Training specialists who are not primarily editors pre-empts project difficulties
  • Training managers lets them structure and run content teams efficiently
  • Editorial training means content designers work more quickly and confidently
  • Training the trainers helps knowledge cascade through the organisation
  • Training gives a high return on investment

Pricing

£450 per person per day

  • Excluding VAT
  • Education pricing available
  • Minimum contract period: Day
